DataElement.preferredName: Patient Risk Eligibility Determination Recurrent Disease Stratification Code
DataElement.preferredDefinition: information relating to the risk assessment criteria to determine eligibility of patients for medical care programs and services._A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary._The return of a disease after a period of remission._The process of classifying patients into a sequence of grades or ranks as part of the randomization process or for purposes of data analysis._A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information relating to the risk assessment criteria to determine eligibility of patients for medical care programs and services.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredDefinition: Risk is the potential future harm that may arise from some present action. It is often combined or confused with the probability of an event which is seen as undesirable. (from WIkipedia):Criteria to determine eligibility of patients for medical care programs and services.

Concepts.definition: The potential future harm that may arise from some present action. It is often combined or confused with the probability of an event which is seen as undesirable.
The act of determining if a subject is suitable for enrollment in a study according specific protocol criteria and procedures.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary._The return of a disease after a period of remission._The process of classifying patients into a sequence of grades or ranks as part of the randomization process or for purposes of data analysis._A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A risk group associated with a total score of 3 or 4 on the Prognostic Index for Peripheral T-cell Lymphoma indicating that an individual has a high risk.

Concepts.longName: Peripheral T-cell Lymphoma Prognostic Index Score 3-4
Concepts.definition: A risk group associated with a total score of 3 or 4 on the Prognostic Index for Peripheral T-cell Lymphoma indicating that an individual has a high risk.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A risk group associated with a total score of 0 on the Prognostic Index for Peripheral T-cell Lymphoma indicating that an individual has a low risk.

Concepts.longName: Peripheral T-cell Lymphoma Prognostic Index Score 0
Concepts.definition: A risk group associated with a total score of 0 on the Prognostic Index for Peripheral T-cell Lymphoma indicating that an individual has a low risk.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.:The return of a disease after a period of remission.:The process of classifying patients into a sequence of grades or ranks as part of the randomization process or for purposes of data analysis.:A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.
The return of a disease after a period of remission.
The process of classifying patients into a sequence of grades or ranks as part of the randomization process or for purposes of data analysis.
